ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Re: Sleeper?
ygData.msgSnippet: Rokenn, Darkwind was with us on Sol Ro before they moved.  I would try talking to Thalanx (if you re not already) or Iisbliss, or Deidda, they are all very
ygData.messageBody:
Rokenn,

Darkwind was with us on Sol Ro before they moved. I would try talking to
Thalanx (if you're not already) or Iisbliss, or Deidda, they are all very
nice and reasonable. However, if they are the same sort of guild as when
they were on Sol Ro. We dealt with their time zone advantage, it was very
rough at times and Paradigm was pretty, well, happy, when they moved to A
Ro.

However, we did have a Trak/VS arrangement with them back in the day, and I
will say that they ALWAYS held up their end of the deal. So if you make a
deal, I would bet they would stick to it :)

Hally

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Rokenn [mailto:pwr3@...]
> Sent: Friday, August 24, 2001 2:01 PM
> To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [eqbards] Re: Sleeper?
>
>
> Well I can not get to EZBoards from work, so I can not comment on the
> thread you posted a link to. I do know that EW(my guild) has been
> kicking around the idea of waking the Sleeper. One of the main
> reasons they have been thinking about it is due to pressure from
> Darkwind. Not to get too deep into ARo server politics, but DW was
> immense time zone advantage on ARo and uses it ruthlessly to their
> advantage (they are a mainly western Europe guild). They are pretty
> much the number two guild on the server and have overran us before
> and not been very forthcoming in trying to work out any kind of
> arrangement on either Sleepers or N Tov. And as far as some of the
> other upcoming guilds (SoT, CB, and others) they have been leaching
> off of EW's work for the last month or so. Case in point was SoT &
> CB using CoH to try and do the back dragons in N ToV earlier this
> week to avoid having to fight the tougher mobs at the start. Also
> PoM is getting very overcrowded, some nights we have had 30+ people
> run by us after we have cleared the way to PoM. Now that we have
> cleared N ToV three (or four? can not remember) times it is starting
> to get a little old. Leaving only 2 real challenges left, the 4th
> Warder and the AoW. So I would suspect that EW will be making a real
> effort on Sleepers sometime in the future.
>
> One interesting thing about Abashi's post regarding the changes
> wrought by waking the Sleeper is that it seems to allude to a quest
> to re-imprison him. He also hinted at other changes to the zone and
> I have heard that the guards seem to be dropping more primal then
> they did in the past. so it may not be as bad as it would seem if
> the Sleeper is let loose.
>
> Rokenn
>
> --- In eqbards@y..., "Cyr, Thierry" <thierry.cyr@e...> wrote:
> > Rokenn, let me right off the bat say I've always had great respect
> for you
> > and the work you've put into your bard and your site. My email is
> not
> > intended as a bash to you or your guild, but this thread has me
> concerned.
> >
> > http://pub42.ezboard.com/fayonaerofrm6.showMessage?topicID=335.topic
> > http://www.lumthemad.net/news/2064.php
> >
> > I think its cool that a guild would be attempting this, but if the
> warders
> > dont respawn, then to me, bites, and will have an impact on the
> entire
> > server community, not just ew, dw and vv but futur guilds that
> would like to
> > go to ST as well... Take Rathe for example, it supposedly has had
> no warder
> > spawn since the sleeper was awakened. :(
> >
> > I might have my info wrong, I might not, either way I hope they
> dont go
> > away.
> >
> > Minkin the worried
> > A Ro
>
>
